snippet: James Lunn had been detained for more than six weeks after his arrest in the Sinai Peninsula in a security sweep in August.
abstract: James Lunn, American citizen detained by Egyptian authorities for more than six weeks, is found dead in police station in what some American officials say appears to be suicide; death raises further concerns about safety of foreign citizens in Egyptian jails.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: James Lunn had been detained for more than six weeks after his arrest in the Sinai Peninsula in a security sweep in August.

headline.main: American Held in Egypt Killed Himself, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: American Held in Egypt Killed Himself, Officials Say
